title: Not a good impression for me Riot.
body:
Now I'm obviously not blaming this on Riot, I have been playing this game for months now to get my level up and learning stuff, but the community is such a push-away. I've been trying my best to just ignore people, the problem is every single game there we be either 1 lane steal and 1 of the following;
-Intentional feeders
-Intentional afkers
-Flamers / angry people

I just played a game where we had someone lock in their Yasuo top, and then a Singed locked in top and proxied first few minutes. The Yasuo was mad about this (i think) but he still played top. Singed was only proxying, but Yasuo couldn't get any farm. So he died to the enemy top laner, and starting feeding intentionally. Nothing could convince him otherwise. On the rest of the map we were winning, and could've won. He kept going "He instalocked, I ruin the game. Simple". And when I told him to stop he said "How about i show mid some love". All the effort I put into the mirror matchup kat defeating her was lost.

I know people don't like to listen to other people's shenanigans but this is appalling. I've had this account for a while so I kind of get that it slowly progresses to get better, but what about a completely new player? What are they going to think? I'll tell you what, they will probably give up and not play. Everyone is telling them to uninstall.

Here is the current state of low level games. 1-2 new players, 8 one trick bronze smurfs that don't really outperform the new guys, some reason picked beginner when they made their smurf because they want to feel good at the game. They will act incredibly toxic and ruin the game if things don't go there way. This is not only frustrating for new players but makes them act this way.

The report system seriously needs to be more effective. If people are doing stuff like this they don't stop after a warning or chat restriction. It should be a timed ban or something. This is a punishment that will both make an impact on reform and will prevent players from turning like this. I really want to keep playing and pick this game up but you have me a complete noob dumpstering people like "RivenMaster420" or some garbage.

At this point I'm going to have to play with my friends because queuing solo is too disruptive to my mood. I can't ignore something that literally looses me games whether I pay any attention to it or not.

I agree wholeheartedly with your post, except for this.

> [{quoted}](name=Xenoblade,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=QFxTsRRh,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-12-19T20:01:45.666+0000)
>
> Now I&#039;m obviously not blaming this on Riot, 



It is riots fault, and will continue to be riots fault until they 
spend some money and give us the tools to do something
about feeders/trolls etc.

That or as you say there is some MASSIVE improvement 
to the reporting system.

In my opinion three years after removing tribunal,
they haven't delivered on anything apart from the 
naughty word filter, which you know. was really solved
when we got the mute button.

Hopefully these problems start hitting their bottom line
because no amount of posts asking for them to do 
something about trolls and feeders seems to have
spurred any action in.. yeah 3/4 years..

Unfortunately stuff like this does happen more often than it should :( 

The report system it already doing a pretty good job in terms of punishments IMO. You can get 2 week bans and even perma-bans if you continue to flame and feed.

_What I'd really like to see is more focus on prevention._

+ For example; when there is a disagreement in champion select,  you're actually supposed to dodge the game. But this doesn't make sense to a lot of new players because they get punished for dodging. That's bad design on Riot's behalf IMO

 **What we really should have is some kind of system that allows us to dodge sometimes without penalty.** That might be something like; getting one free dodge every 4 games, or letting people vote in champion select to kick a toxic player out.

It's when these systems that we need don't exist, that the problem does become Riot's fault to some extent. 

__*

Those are just my thoughts though. 

In the meantime I think you idea of playing with your friends is a really good solution. And TBH League is more fun with friends regardless of toxicity :D

Realistically, the punishment system should be working. SHOULD being the key word. In reality, it isn't and it's known by everyone.

Everyone seems to misunderstand this frequently, so I'll reiterate it again; **_If something isn't working as well as it should, that doesn't mean it's not working at all._**

+ _Does the system catch some intentional feeders?_ 

 Yes, that's because the system is working.


+ _Does the system catch all intentional feeders?_ 

 No, that's because the system isn't working **perfectly**.

I agree with anyone who says the system needs a lot of improvement. But I can't agree with people who say the system isn't working at all, because that's literally not true.
